Stidham, who looks likely to replace Tom Brady as New England’ s starting quarterback in the fall, broke the news of his workouts with Edelman on Twitter. Responding to an Instagram post by former...
text:
The Patriots' practice facility may still be closed to players due to the
coronavirus pandemic, but that hasn't stopped two of the team's key playmakers
from getting together to work on their chemistry.

Quarterback Jarrett Stidham and wide receiver Julian Edelman are both in
Massachusetts and have been "seeing each other almost every day," according to
ESPN's Mike Reiss (on Twitter).

Stidham, who looks likely to replace Tom Brady as New England's starting
quarterback in the fall, broke the news of his workouts with Edelman on
Twitter. Responding to an Instagram post by former Red Sox (and current
Brewers) infielder Brock Holt, Stidham hinted at the fact he had been working
out with Edelman.

"We've been at it... where you at bro?!!" Stidham wrote.

This season will be the first of Edelman's 10-year career in which he will be
without Brady, so it will likely take some time to get used to working with a
new quarterback. After a delayed start to the offseason due to strict social
distancing guidelines, players -- including Brady and a few of his Buccaneers
teammates -- are starting to get together for informal workouts.

Edelman has not spoken to reporters since Brady left for the Buccaneers in
March. But other members of the Patriots' organization (including head coach
Bill Belichick and defensive back Devin McCourty) have praised the young
Auburn product in recent months.

"(Stidham) worked really hard last year, was our backup quarterback the entire
season," Belichick said shortly after the draft. "I know he's working hard in
the offseason. He's made a lot of progress in terms of understanding our
offense and understanding opponent defenses like all players do from year one
to year two. I'm sure he'll get out there and be ready to go, be prepared,
compete hard, and we'll see where it takes us."

"I think he's a young guy who's eager to learn. That quarterback position is
always a hard position," McCourty said. "Right away, he worked extremely
hard."

"I'm excited for that quarterback room. I think they're itching," McCourty
added. "You get an opportunity to go out there and compete, that's what we all
want. I think for us as players at other positions, we need to focus on what
we have to do. Not fall into the trap of the media, like everybody worried
about the quarterback room. We just control what we can control and the rest
will take care of itself."

Related links:

Bill Belichick: Jarrett Stidham has 'made a lot of progress' from year 1 to
year 2 with Patriots

Jarrett Stidham, Patriots quarterbacks itching to compete, says Devin McCourty

Tom Brady's replacement? Patriots QB Jarrett Stidham 'has a lot of great
qualities,' says Matthew Slater

title: New England Patriots’ Jarrett Stidham, Julian Edelman working out together ‘almost every day’ (report) [masslive.com]
html:
The Patriots’ practice facility may still be closed to players due to the coronavirus pandemic, but that hasn’t stopped two of the team’s key playmakers from getting together to work on their chemistry.

Quarterback Jarrett Stidham and wide receiver Julian Edelman are both in Massachusetts and have been “seeing each other almost every day," according to ESPN’s Mike Reiss (on Twitter).

Stidham, who looks likely to replace Tom Brady as New England’s starting quarterback in the fall, broke the news of his workouts with Edelman on Twitter. Responding to an Instagram post by former Red Sox (and current Brewers) infielder Brock Holt, Stidham hinted at the fact he had been working out with Edelman.

“We’ve been at it... where you at bro?!!" Stidham wrote.

This season will be the first of Edelman’s 10-year career in which he will be without Brady, so it will likely take some time to get used to working with a new quarterback. After a delayed start to the offseason due to strict social distancing guidelines, players -- including Brady and a few of his Buccaneers teammates -- are starting to get together for informal workouts.

Edelman has not spoken to reporters since Brady left for the Buccaneers in March. But other members of the Patriots’ organization (including head coach Bill Belichick and defensive back Devin McCourty) have praised the young Auburn product in recent months.

“(Stidham) worked really hard last year, was our backup quarterback the entire season," Belichick said shortly after the draft. "I know he’s working hard in the offseason. He’s made a lot of progress in terms of understanding our offense and understanding opponent defenses like all players do from year one to year two. I’m sure he’ll get out there and be ready to go, be prepared, compete hard, and we’ll see where it takes us.”

“I think he’s a young guy who’s eager to learn. That quarterback position is always a hard position,” McCourty said. “Right away, he worked extremely hard.”

“I’m excited for that quarterback room. I think they’re itching," McCourty added. "You get an opportunity to go out there and compete, that’s what we all want. I think for us as players at other positions, we need to focus on what we have to do. Not fall into the trap of the media, like everybody worried about the quarterback room. We just control what we can control and the rest will take care of itself.”

Related links:
